source_sentence: 後漢安息國三藏安世高譯
translation: An Shigao Translation of the Tripiṭaka of the Later Han Kingdom of Anzhi

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在羅閱祇國，與大比丘千二百五十人俱、菩薩摩訶薩、天龍八部，大眾集會說法。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the country of Rājagṛha with 1,250 great monks, bodhisattvas, Mahāsattvas, gods, dragons, and the eight groups of people who had gathered to preach.

source_sentence: 時世人民，施者無量。
translation: At the time, there were countless people in the world who gave alms.

source_sentence: 有一貧人，唯有一爛壞手巾，意欲布施，懼此物惡，猶豫未決。
translation: There was a poor man who had only a tattered handkerchief and wanted to give it away, but he was afraid it would be bad and hesitated.

source_sentence: 爾時，座中有一比丘尼，名曰[木*奈]女，即從座起，整服作禮，長跪叉手，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, a nun named [Mok*na] who was sitting in the audience rose from her seat, adjusted her robes, paid homage, knelt down with her palms together, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我自念先世生波羅[木*奈]國，為貧女人。
translation: I myself remembered that in a previous life I was born in the country of [Mokṣala*Nāga] and became a poor woman.

source_sentence: 時世有佛，名曰迦葉，時與大眾圍繞說法。
translation: At the time, there was a Buddha named Kāśyapa who was surrounded by people and taught.

source_sentence: 坐聞經歡喜，意欲布施，顧無所有，自惟貧賤，心用悲感，詣他園圃，求乞果蓏，當以施佛。
translation: He rejoiced when he heard the sūtras and wanted to give alms, but since he didn't have anything, he considered himself poor and destitute, and was moved by pity to go to another garden and ask for fruit and fruit that would be given to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時得一[木*奈]，大而香好，擎一盂水并[木*奈]一枚，奉迦葉佛及諸眾僧。
translation: He then obtained a [log*nai], large and fragrant, and carried a [log*nai] bowl of water and one [log*nai] to present to Kāśyapa Buddha and the monks.

source_sentence: 佛知至意，呪願受之，分布水[木*奈]，一切周普。
translation: Knowing what he wanted, the Buddha accepted it with a curse and vow, distributing the water [mokṣaṇa] and making it available to all.

source_sentence: 緣此福祚，壽盡生天，得為天后；下生世間，不由胞胎，九十一劫，生[木*奈]華中，端正鮮潔，常識宿命，今值世尊開示道眼。」
translation: Because of this fortune, he was born in heaven at the end of his life and became the queen of gods; he was born down in the world, not by a child, for 91 eons, among [muktagna] flowers, correct and pure, always aware of his past lives, and now the Bhagavān has opened his eyes to the path."

source_sentence: 爾時[木*奈]女以偈頌曰：「三尊慈潤普，　　慧度無男女，　水果施弘報，　　緣得離眾苦。
translation: The [Mok*na] woman then spoke in verse, "The Threefold Honored One's compassion nourishes them all, his wisdom liberates neither boys nor girls, and his fruits are generous in reward, which frees him from all suffering.

source_sentence: 在世生華中，　　上則為天后，　自歸聖眾祐，　　福田最深厚。」
translation: Among the flowers that arise in this world, the elder is the queen of the gods, and she takes refuge in the noble ones, whose field of merit is most profound."

source_sentence: 比丘尼[木*奈]女，禮已還坐。
translation: The nun [mu*na] returned to her seat after paying homage.

source_sentence: 佛在世時，維耶梨國王苑中，自然生一[木*奈]樹，枝葉繁茂，實又加大，既有光色，香美非凡。
translation: When the Buddha was alive, there was a [muktagna] tree that naturally grew in the king's court in Vialli, whose branches and leaves were exuberant and whose fruit was large and shiny, and it had an extraordinary fragrance.

source_sentence: 王寶愛此[木*奈]，自非中宮尊貴美人，不得啖此[木*奈]果。
translation: The king loved this [muktagna] so much that he couldn't have eaten its fruit unless he had someone of honor and beauty in his middle palace.

source_sentence: 國中有梵志居士，財富無數，一國無雙，又聰明博達，才智超群，王重愛之，用為大臣。
translation: There was a priest in the kingdom whose wealth was incalculable, unmatched in a single country, and whose intelligence and versatility were so outstanding that the king loved him and made him his minister.

source_sentence: 王請梵志飯食，食畢以一[木*奈]實與之。
translation: The king invited the priest for a meal and gave him a [mu*nai] fruit after the meal.

source_sentence: 梵志見[木*奈]香美非凡，乃問王曰：「此[木*奈]樹下，寧有小栽可得乞不？」
translation: Seeing the extraordinary fragrance of the [muktagna], the priest asked the king, "Is there a small plant under this [muktagna] tree that I could beg for?"

source_sentence: 王曰：「大多小栽，吾恐妨其大樹，輒除去之，卿若欲得，今當相與。」
translation: The king said, "Most of the small plants I planted were afraid they would interfere with the large tree, so I removed them quickly.

source_sentence: 即以一[木*奈]栽與梵志。
translation: He then gave a [wood*nai] plant to the priest.

source_sentence: 梵志得歸種之，朝夕溉灌，日日長大，枝條茂好，三年生實，光彩大小，如王家[木*奈]。
translation: The priest got it back and planted it, irrigated it day and night, and it grew bigger every day, with nice branches, and in three years it produced fruit that was as lustrous and large as the king's [muktaghosa].

source_sentence: 梵志大喜，自念：「我家資財無數，不減於王，唯無此[木*奈]，以為不如，今已得之，為無減王。」
translation: The priest was overjoyed and thought to himself, "My family has countless possessions that are not less than the king's, except for this [muna], which I thought was not as good.

source_sentence: 即取食之，而大苦澁，了不可食。
translation: He then took it and ate it, but it was so bitter and rough that he couldn't eat it anymore.

source_sentence: 梵志更大愁惱，乃退思惟：「當是土無肥潤故耳。」
translation: Further distressed, the priest withdrew and thought, "Perhaps it's because the soil isn't fertile."

source_sentence: 乃捉取百牛之乳，以飲一牛，復取此一牛乳，煎之為醍醐，以灌[木*奈]根。
translation: He then took the milk of a hundred cows and drank from one cow, and then he took the milk of that one cow, boiled it into ghee, and poured it on his [mu*nai] faculties.

source_sentence: 日日灌之，到至明年，實乃甘美，如王家[木*奈]。
translation: He poured it out day after day, and by the next year it was really as sweet as the king's [mokṣaṇa].

source_sentence: 而[木*奈]樹邊，忽復生一瘤節，大如手拳，日日增長，梵志心念：「忽有此瘤節，恐妨其實。」
translation: When a knot suddenly appeared on the [muktagna] tree's edge, as large as a hand's fist, growing larger every day, the priest thought, "Suddenly this knot appears, and I'm afraid it might harm the truth."

source_sentence: 適欲斫去，恐復傷樹，連日思惟，遲徊未決。
translation: He wanted to chop it down, but he was afraid it would hurt the tree again, so he continued to think about it for days, hesitating but not deciding.

source_sentence: 而節中忽生一枝，正指上向，洪直調好高出樹巔，去地七丈，其杪乃分作諸枝，周圍旁出，形如偃蓋，花葉茂好，勝於本樹。
translation: Then a branch suddenly sprouted from the knot, pointing straight upward, rising straight and tall above the top of the tree, seven feet above the ground, and its limb was divided into branches that sprouted out around it like a supreme lid, with flowers and leaves that were more exquisite than the original tree.

source_sentence: 梵志怪之：「不知枝上當何所有？」
translation: The priest wondered, "I wonder what's on that branch?"

source_sentence: 乃作棧閣，登而視之。
translation: He then built a palanquin and climbed up to look at it.

source_sentence: 見枝上偃蓋之中，乃有池水，既清且香，又有眾華，彩色鮮明。
translation: He saw a pond in the middle of a shrine on a branch that was both clear and fragrant, and there were flowers of vivid color.

source_sentence: 披視華下，有一女兒，在池水中，梵志抱取，歸養長之，名曰[木*奈]女。
translation: Looking down at the flowers, he saw a daughter in the pond water. The priest took her, adopted her, and raised her, and called her [Mok*na] girl.

source_sentence: 至年十五，顏色端正，天下無雙，宣聞遠國。
translation: When she reached the age of fifteen, her color was so beautiful and correct that she was unequaled in the whole world and was proclaimed to be of great renown.

source_sentence: 有七國王，同時俱來，詣梵志所，求娉[木*奈]女，以為夫人。
translation: Seven kingdoms came together at the same time and asked the priestess to give them [Mok*na] as his wife.

source_sentence: 梵志大恐怖，不知當以與誰？
translation: The priest was terrified, wondering whom he would give her to.

source_sentence: 乃於園中，架一高樓，以[木*奈]女著上，出謂諸王曰：「此女非我所生，自出於[木*奈]樹之上，亦不知是天、龍、鬼神女耶？
translation: In the middle of the garden, he erected a high building, put a [muktagna] woman on it, and went out to the kings, saying, "This woman was not born by me, but she came out of the [muktagna] tree, and I don't know if she's a god, dragon, or demon woman.

source_sentence: 鬼魅之物？
translation: A demonic being?

source_sentence: 今七王求之，我設與一王，六王當怒，不敢愛惜也。
translation: Now, if I were to give it to one of the seven kings who want it, the six kings would be angry and wouldn't dare to cherish it.

source_sentence: 女今在園中樓上，諸王便自平議，有應得者便自取去，非我所制也。」
translation: Now, while the woman is up on the tower in the garden, the kings can agree among themselves, and whoever deserves it can take it themselves; it's not mine to control."

source_sentence: 於是七王口共爭之，紛紜未決。
translation: The seven kings then argued with each other orally, but the dispute was still unresolved.

source_sentence: 至其夜，瓶沙王從伏瀆中入，登樓就之共宿，明晨當去。
translation: At the end of the night, King Bimbisāra entered from the Vatsa River, climbed up on the tower, and stayed there with him.

source_sentence: [木*奈]女白曰：「大王幸枉威尊，接逮於我，今復相捨而去，若其有子，則是王種，當何所付？」
translation: The [Mok*nā] woman said, "Your majesty was fortunate to have taken advantage of our authority and respect, but now that we've left each other, if he has a son, then what will he give to the king's seed?"

source_sentence: 王曰：「若是男兒，當以還我；若是女兒，便以與汝。」
translation: The king said, "If it's a boy, he'll give it back to me; if it's a daughter, he'll give it to you."

source_sentence: 王則脫手金鐶之印，以付[木*奈]女，以是為信。
translation: The king then took off his hand and gave the [Mok*na] woman a gold ring with a seal, taking this as a sign of faith.

source_sentence: 便出語群臣言：「我已得[木*奈]女與一宿，亦無奇異，故如凡人，故不取耳。」
translation: He then spoke to the ministers, saying, "I've already had [Mok*na] girl with me for one night, and there's nothing strange about her; I'm just like an ordinary person, so I won't take her."

source_sentence: 瓶沙軍中皆稱萬歲，曰：「我王已得[木*奈]女。」
translation: Everyone in Bimbisāra's army said, "Long live the king, for we've already gotten [Mok*na] girl."

source_sentence: 六王聞之便各還去。
translation: Upon hearing this, the six kings each returned.

source_sentence: 瓶沙王去後，遂便有娠。
translation: After King Bimbisāra left, he became pregnant.

source_sentence: 時[木*奈]女勅守門人言：「若有求見我者，當語言我病。」
translation: The [Mokṣadāna] woman then commanded the gatekeeper, saying, "If anyone asks to see me, you must tell them I'm sick."

source_sentence: 後日，月滿生一男兒，顏貌端正，兒生則手持針藥囊。
translation: The day after that, when the moon was full, a boy was born, with a handsome face, and he was carrying a needle and medicine bag.

source_sentence: 梵志曰：「此國王之子，而執醫器，必醫王也。」
translation: The priest said, "This is the son of the king, and he's carrying a medicine bag; he must be the king's doctor."

source_sentence: 時[木*奈]女即以白衣裹兒，勅婢持棄著巷中，婢即受勅，抱往棄之。
translation: The [Mok*Nai] woman then wrapped her son in a white robe and ordered her handmaid to take it and throw it away in the alley, and the handmaid complied with the order, carrying him to the alley and throwing him away.

source_sentence: 時王子無畏，清旦乘車，往欲見大王，遣人除屏道路。
translation: The prince was fearless and rode in his chariot at sunrise, hoping to see the king, and he sent someone to remove the screens from the road.

source_sentence: 時王子遙見道中有白物，即住車問傍人言：「此白物是何等？」
translation: The prince then saw something white in the road from a distance, so he stopped his chariot and asked those nearby, "What's this white thing?"

source_sentence: 答言：「此是小兒。」
translation: He answered, "This is a small child."

source_sentence: 問言：「死活？」
translation: He asked, "Dead or alive?"

source_sentence: 答言：「故活。」
translation: He replied, "So he's alive."

source_sentence: 王子勅人抱取，即覓乳母養之以活。
translation: The prince asked someone to take him and find a wet nurse to nurture him back to life.

source_sentence: 梵志將此小兒，還付[木*奈]女，名曰祇域。
translation: The priest took the boy and returned him to [Mok*Nai], who called him Jīvaka.

source_sentence: 至年八歲，聰明高才，學問書疏，越殊倫匹，與隣比小兒遊戲，心常輕諸小兒，以不如己。
translation: When he was eight years old, he was brilliant and highly talented, and his learning and writing were beyond compare.

source_sentence: 諸小兒共罵之曰：「無父之子，婬女所生，何敢輕我？」
translation: The younger children all scolded him, saying, "How dare you despise me, a fatherless son born of a promiscuous daughter?"

source_sentence: 祇域愕然，默而不答。
translation: Stunned, Jīvaka remained silent and didn't answer.

source_sentence: 便歸問母曰：「我視子曹，皆不如我，而反罵我言：『無父之子。』
translation: He then went back to his mother and asked her, "I've looked at my sons and Tso, and they're all inferior to me, yet they say to me, 'Fatherless sons!'

source_sentence: 我父今者，為在何許？」
translation: Now, where is my father?"

source_sentence: 母曰：「汝父者，正瓶沙王是也。」
translation: His mother said, "Your father is the rightful Vibhāṣā king."

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「瓶沙王乃在羅閱祇國，去此五百里，何緣生我？
translation: Gṛdhrakūṭa said, "King Vātsī is in Rājagṛha, which is 500 miles away, so what was the reason he gave birth to me?

source_sentence: 若如母言，何以證之？」
translation: If it's as my mother said, how can I prove it?"

source_sentence: 母則出印鐶示之曰：「此則汝父鐶也。」
translation: His mother then showed him her ring, saying, "This is your father's ring."

source_sentence: 祇域省之，見有瓶沙王印文，便奉持此鐶往到羅閱祇。
translation: Guṇaviputra examined it and saw that it had the seal of King Bimbisāra. He took this ring and went to Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 徑入宮門，門無訶者，即到王前，為王作禮，長跪白王言：「我是王子，[木*奈]女所生，今年八歲，始知是大王種類，故持鐶印信，遠來歸家。」
translation: He went straight to the palace gate, and when there was no reprimanding officer at the gate, he went up to the king, paid homage to him, knelt down long, and said to him, "I'm a prince born to a [mu*nai] woman. I'm eight years old now, and I've just realized that I'm the great king's type.

source_sentence: 王見印文，覺憶昔之誓，知是其子，愴然矜之，以為太子。
translation: When the king saw the seal, he remembered his vow and knew it was his son. He took pity on him and made him his crown prince.

source_sentence: 涉歷二年，後阿闍世王生，祇域因白王曰：「我初生時，手把針藥囊，是應當為醫也。
translation: After two years of wandering around, King Ajātaśatru was born, and Guṇḍa said to the king, "When I was first born, I was holding a needle and medicine bag in my hand, so I should be a doctor.

source_sentence: 王雖以我為太子，非我所樂；王今自有嫡子生矣，應襲尊嗣，我願得行學醫術。」
translation: Although the king may have made me a prince, it wasn't my wish; now that the king has had his firstborn son born, he should inherit the title, and I would like to train as a doctor."

source_sentence: 王則聽之，王曰：「汝不為太子者，不得空食王祿，應學醫道。」
translation: The king then listened, saying, "If you don't become a prince, you mustn't take the king's salary in vain; you must train in the path of medicine."

source_sentence: 王即命勅國中諸上手醫，盡術教之，而祇域但行嬉戲，未曾受學。
translation: The king then ordered the country's top doctors to teach him all their techniques, but Jijie only played around and didn't accept the lessons.

source_sentence: 諸師責謂之曰：「醫術鄙陋，誠非太子至尊所宜當學，然大王之命不可違廢。
translation: The masters rebuked him, saying, "The art of medicine is so rudimentary that it's really not something the crown prince should learn, but the king's orders must not be disobeyed.

source_sentence: 受勅已來，積有日月，而太子初不受半言之方，若王問我，我何以對？」
translation: Days and months have passed since I was commanded, but the prince didn't accept half of the directions he was given in the first place.

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「我生而有醫證在手，故白大王捐棄榮號求學醫術，豈復懈怠煩師督促？
translation: Jīvaka said, "I was born with medical knowledge in my hand, so I've asked the great king to renounce his title and pursue medical training.

source_sentence: 直以諸師之道無足學者故耳。」
translation: It's simply because there aren't enough teachers to learn from."

source_sentence: 便取本草藥方針脈諸經，具難問師，師窮無以答，皆下為祇域作禮，長跪叉手曰：「今日益知太子神聖，實非我等所及也。
translation: They then took the scriptures on materia medica, prescriptions, needles, and veins, and asked their masters about them, but they were at a loss for an answer.

source_sentence: 向所問諸事，皆是我師歷世疑義所不能通，願太子具悉說之，開解我曹生年之結。」
translation: The questions we've been asking are all things that our teacher has had doubts about for ages, so may the prince explain them all and untie the knots that have bound us all during our lives."

source_sentence: 祇域便為解說其義，諸醫歡喜皆更起，頭面作禮，承受其法。
translation: Guṇavik then explained their meaning, and the doctors rejoiced as they all rose again, bowed their heads, and accepted his teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時，祇域即自念言：「王勅諸醫，都無可學者，誰當教我學醫道？
translation: It was then that Jyoti thought to himself, "The king has commanded that there are no doctors who are capable of learning, so who will teach me the path of medicine?

source_sentence: 時聞彼德叉尸羅國，有醫姓阿提梨，字賓迦羅，極善醫道，彼能教我。」
translation: I heard that in that country of Takṣaśīla, there's a doctor named Atri, whose name is Piṅgala, who's very good at the path of healing and who can teach me."

source_sentence: 爾時，祇域童子即往彼國，詣賓迦羅所白言：「大師！
translation: The boy from Jeta then went to that country, visited Piṅgala, and said, "Great teacher!

source_sentence: 我今請仁者以為師範。」
translation: Now, I'd like to ask a kind man to serve as my teacher and example."

source_sentence: 從學醫術，經七年已，自念言：「我今習學醫術，何當有已？」
translation: After seven years of training in the art of healing, he thought to himself, "Now that I've practiced the art of healing, how could there be any more?"

source_sentence: 即往師所白言：「我今習學醫術，何當有已？」
translation: He went to his teacher and said, "Now that I've practiced medicine, how could there be any more?"

source_sentence: 時師即與一籠器及掘草之具：「汝可於德叉尸羅國面一由旬，求覓諸草，有非是藥者持來。」
translation: The teacher then gave him a cage and tools for digging up weeds, "Go for a leap of faith in the land of Takṣaśīla and search for weeds that aren't medicine, and bring them to me if you have any that aren't medicine."

source_sentence: 時祇域即如師勅，於德叉尸羅國面一由旬，求覓非是藥者，周竟不得非是藥者，所見草木一切物善能分別，知有所用處無非藥者。
translation: Guṇḍa then did as his teacher instructed and went searching for something that wasn't medicine for a yojana in front of Takṣaśīla. After going around, he found nothing that wasn't medicine and was able to discern well all the plants and trees he saw, knowing that there was nowhere he used that wasn't medicine.

source_sentence: 彼即空還，往師所白如是言：「師今當知，我於德叉尸羅國求非藥草者，面一由旬，周竟不見非藥者，所見草木盡能分別，所入用處。」
translation: He then returned to the master empty-handed and said, "Now, teacher, you must know that I looked for a herb that wasn't medicine in Takṣaśīla for a period of one yojana, but I couldn't find anything that wasn't medicine, and I was able to discern all the plants and trees I saw and find a place to use them."

source_sentence: 師答祇域言：「汝今可去，醫道已成。
translation: The teacher answered Jyoti, "Now, you can go, for the path of healing has been accomplished.

source_sentence: 我於閻浮提中，最為第一；我若死後，次復有汝。」
translation: I'm the best among the Jambudvīpa, and if I die, you'll be next."

source_sentence: 於是，祇域便行治病，所治輒愈，國內知名。
translation: Guṇavik then went about treating illnesses and was known throughout the country for his ability to heal easily.

source_sentence: 後欲入宮，於宮門前，逢一小兒擔樵，祇域望視，悉見此兒五藏、腸胃，縷悉分明。
translation: Later, as he was about to enter the palace, he met a young boy carrying a woodcutter at the palace gate. When he looked at him, Guṇavik saw that he had a clear understanding of his five stores and his intestines and stomach.

source_sentence: 祇域心念：「本草經說有藥王樹，從外照內見人腹藏，此兒樵中得無有藥王耶！」
translation: Guhya thought to himself, "The Materia Medica Sutra says there's a king of medicine tree that looks from the outside in and sees the storehouse of a person's belly, could there be a king of medicine in this boy's woodcutter?"

source_sentence: 即往問兒：「賣樵幾錢？」
translation: He went to his son and asked, "How much is the price of the woodcutter for sale?"

source_sentence: 兒白：「十錢。」
translation: The boy said, "Ten coins!"

source_sentence: 便雇錢取樵，下樵置地，闇冥不見腹中。
translation: He then hired money to get a woodcutter, put it down on the ground, and couldn't see it in his belly in the dark.

source_sentence: 祇域更心思惟：「不知束中何所為是藥王？」
translation: Jīvaka then returned to his mind and thought, "I wonder what in that bundle is the king of medicine?"

source_sentence: 便解兩束，一一取之，以著小兒腹上，無所照見，輒復更取，如是盡兩束樵；最後有一小枝，栽長尺餘，試取以照，具見腹內。
translation: He then untied the two bundles, took them one by one, and put them on his son's belly. When nothing was visible, he then took them again and finished the two bundles of woodcutters like this; finally, there was a small branch about a foot long that he tried to take and look at, and it was visible inside his belly.

source_sentence: 祇域大喜，知此小枝定是藥王，悉還兒樵。
translation: Jīvaka was overjoyed and knew that this small branch must be the king of medicines.

source_sentence: 兒既已得錢，樵又如故，歡喜而去。
translation: Now that his son had gotten the money and the woodcutter was as before, he rejoiced and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，祇域自念：「我今先當治誰？
translation: At the time, Jīvaka thought to himself, "Who will I treat first?

source_sentence: 此國既小，又在邊方，我今寧可還本國始開醫道。」
translation: Since this country is small and on the edge, I'd better go back to my own country and begin the path of healing."

source_sentence: 於即還歸婆迦陀城。
translation: He then returned to the city of Bhārgata.

source_sentence: 婆迦陀城中，有大長者，其婦十二年中常患頭痛，眾醫治之而不能差。
translation: In the city of Bhārgata, there was a great elder whose wife had been suffering from headaches for 12 years, and she couldn't be treated by many doctors.

source_sentence: 時祇域聞之，即往其家語守門人言：「白汝長者，有醫在門外。」
translation: When Jīvaka heard about this, he went to his house and told the gatekeeper, "Sir, I'll tell you, there's a doctor outside the gate."

source_sentence: 時守門人即入白：「門外有醫。」
translation: The gatekeeper then went in and said, "There's a doctor outside the door."

source_sentence: 長者婦問言：「醫形貌何似？」
translation: The elderly woman asked, "What does the doctor look like?"

source_sentence: 答言：「是年少。」
translation: They replied, "They're young."

source_sentence: 彼自念言：「老宿諸醫治亦不差，況復年少？」
translation: He thinks to himself, "Even the old doctors didn't treat him badly, so why would he be young?"

source_sentence: 即勅守門人語言：「我今不須醫。」
translation: I then commanded the gatekeeper to say, "Now, I don't need to be healed."

source_sentence: 守門人即出語言：「我已為汝白長者，長者婦言：『今不須醫。』」
translation: The gatekeeper then spoke, "I've told the elder for you, and the elder woman said, 'Now I don't need to heal you.'"

source_sentence: 祇域復言：「汝可白汝長者婦，但聽我治，若差者隨意與我物。」
translation: Again, Jīvaka said, "You may tell the elder woman that you'll only listen to my treatment, and if it's any different, feel free to give me something."

source_sentence: 時守門人復白之：「醫作如是言：『但聽我治，若差隨意與我物。』」
translation: The gatekeeper then again told her, "The doctor said, 'Just listen to my treatment, and if it's any different, feel free to give me something.'"

source_sentence: 長者婦聞已，自念言：「若如是無所損。」
translation: After hearing this, the elderly woman thought to herself, "If this is the case, there's nothing to lose."

source_sentence: 勅守門人喚入。
translation: She then summoned the gatekeeper to enter.

source_sentence: 時祇域入詣長者婦所，問言：「何所患苦？」
translation: Gavāṃpati then entered and went to the elder woman and asked, "What's the cause of your suffering?"

source_sentence: 答言：「患如是如是。」
translation: He replied, "The illness is thus and so."

source_sentence: 復問：「病從何起？」
translation: Again, he asked, "Where did the illness begin?"

source_sentence: 答言：「從如是如是起。」
translation: He replied, "From this and that, it begins."

source_sentence: 復問：「病來久近？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How long has the illness been coming?"

source_sentence: 答言：「病如許時。」
translation: He replied, "When you're ill, it's like this."

source_sentence: 彼問已語言：「我能治汝。」
translation: After he asked, he said, "I can treat you."

source_sentence: 彼即取好藥，以酥煎之，灌長者婦鼻，病者口中酥唾俱出。
translation: He then took some good medicine, boiled it with ghee, and poured it into the elder woman's nose, and both ghee and saliva came out of the patient's mouth.

source_sentence: 時病人即器承之，酥便收取，唾別棄之。
translation: The patient then took the container and accepted it, taking the ghee and discarding the saliva separately.

source_sentence: 時祇域見已，心懷愁惱：「如是少酥不淨，猶尚慳惜，況能報我？」
translation: When Jīvaka saw this, he was troubled, "How could you be stingy and stingy about such a little ghee that's impure, so how could you repay me?"

source_sentence: 病者見已，問祇域言：「汝愁惱耶！」
translation: When the sick man saw this, he asked Gṛdhrakūṭa, "Are you sad and troubled?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實爾。」
translation: He answered, "It's true."

source_sentence: 問言：「何故愁惱？」
translation: He asked, "What's the reason for the distress?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我自念言：『此少酥不淨，猶尚慳惜，況能報我？』
translation: He replied, "I thought to myself, 'How can I repay this little bit of bread that's impure when I'm still stingy with it?'

source_sentence: 以是故愁耳。」
translation: That's why you're sad."

source_sentence: 長者婦答言：「為家不易，棄之何益？
translation: The elder woman replied, "It's not easy to make a home, so what's the use of throwing it away?

source_sentence: 可用燃燈，是故收取。
translation: It's usable as a burning lamp, so I'll take it.

source_sentence: 汝但治病，何憂如是？」
translation: Why do you worry about this when you can only treat illness?"

source_sentence: 彼即治之，後病得差。
translation: They then treated him, and his illness was healed.

source_sentence: 時長者婦，與四十萬兩金，并奴婢車馬。
translation: The elder woman then gave her 400,000 taels of gold and her slaves, chariots, and horses.

source_sentence: 時祇域得此物已，還王舍城，詣無畏王子門，語守門人言：「汝往白王言：『祇域在外。』」
translation: When Javert got this, he returned to Rājagṛha and went to the gate of the fearless prince and told the gatekeeper, "Go and tell the king, 'Javert is outside.'"

source_sentence: 守門人即入白王，王勅守門人喚入。
translation: The gatekeeper then went in and told the king, and the king summoned the gatekeeper to enter.

source_sentence: 祇域入已，前頭面禮已，在一面住，以前因緣，具白無畏王子言：「以今所得物，盡用上王。」
translation: After entering, he bowed his head to his face, stayed to one side, and told Prince Fearless exactly what he had done before, "I'll use all the things I have now for the king."

source_sentence: 王子言：「且止不須，便為供養已，汝自用之。」
translation: The prince said, "Stop right there, you don't need it; just make offerings and use them yourself."

source_sentence: 此是祇域最初治病。
translation: This was the first time Jīvaka treated a sickness.

source_sentence: 爾時拘睒彌國，有長者子，輪上嬉戲，腸結腹內，食飲不消，亦不得出，彼國無能治者。
translation: At the time, there was an elderly man in Kauśāmbī who was playing on a wheel and had intestines and stomach that were so tight they couldn't eat or drink or get out, and there was no one in that country who could treat it.

source_sentence: 彼聞摩竭國有大醫善能治病，即遣使白王：「拘睒彌長者子病，祇域能治，願王遣來。」
translation: They heard that there was a great physician in Maghā who was skilled at treating illnesses, so they sent an envoy to the king, saying, "The elder son of Kauśāmbī is sick and wants the king to send someone who can treat him."

source_sentence: 時瓶沙王，喚祇域問言：「拘睒彌長者子病，汝能治不？」
translation: The king of Vaiśravaṇa then summoned Gṛdhrakū and asked, "Can you treat the illness of the elder son of Kauśāmbī?"

source_sentence: 答言：「能！」
translation: replied, "Yes!"

source_sentence: 「若能，汝可往治之。」
translation: "If you can, you can go and treat it."

source_sentence: 時祇域乘車，詣拘睒彌。
translation: Jīvaka then rode up to Kauśāmbī in his chariot.

source_sentence: 祇域始至，長者子已死，伎樂送出。
translation: When Jīvaka first arrived, the elder's son had died, and music was playing to escort him out.

source_sentence: 祇域聞聲即問言：「此是何等伎樂鼓聲？」
translation: When Jīvaka heard the sound, he asked, "What kind of musical drumming is this?"

source_sentence: 傍人答言：「是汝所為來，長者子已死，是彼伎樂音聲。」
translation: The person next to him replied, "You came because the eldest son is dead, and this is the sound of his music."

source_sentence: 祇域善能分別一切音聲，即言語：「使迴還，此非死人。」
translation: Good at discerning all sounds, Jīvaka then said, "Return, for this is not a dead person."

source_sentence: 語已，即便迴還。
translation: After he said that, he even returned.

source_sentence: 時祇域即下車，取利刀破腹，披腸結處，示其父母諸親語言：「此是輪上嬉戲，使腸結如是，食飲不消，非是死也。」
translation: Guṇavik then got out of the car, took a sharp knife, cut open his belly, and showed his parents and relatives where his intestines were knotted, saying, "This is play on the wheel, which knots up his intestines like this and prevents him from eating or drinking, but he's not dead."

source_sentence: 即為解腹，還復本處，縫皮肉合，以好藥塗之，瘡即愈，毛還生，與無瘡處不異。
translation: He then freed himself from the abdomen, returned to his original spot, sewed up the skin and flesh, rubbed it with a good medicine, and the sores healed immediately, and his hair grew back, no different from where it hadn't been.

source_sentence: 時長者子，即報祇域四十萬兩金，婦亦與四十萬兩金，長者父母亦爾，各與四十萬兩金。
translation: The elder's son then rewarded Jīvaka with 400,000 taels of gold, and the woman also gave him 400,000 taels of gold, as did the elder's parents.

source_sentence: 祇域念言：「夫為師者須報其恩，今持一百六十萬兩金，與德叉尸羅國大師賓迦羅。」
translation: Jīvaka thought, "A teacher must repay his kindness; now, I'll take 1,600,000 taels of gold and give it to Piṅgala, the great teacher of Takṣaśīla."

source_sentence: 念已，持金詣師所，頭面禮師足，奉上此金：「唯願大師，哀愍納受。」
translation: After he remembered this, he took the gold and went to the teacher, bowed his head at his feet, and presented it to him, "Please accept it with kindness, Great Teacher."

source_sentence: 師曰：「便為供養已，我不須此寶。」
translation: The teacher said, "After making this offering, I don't need this treasure."

source_sentence: 祇域慇懃至到，賓迦羅乃受此金，祇域奉辭禮足而去。
translation: When Jīvaka arrived with courtesy, Piṅgala accepted the gold, and Jīvaka bowed his head and feet and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，國中有迦羅越家女，年十五臨當嫁日，忽頭痛而死。
translation: At the time, there was a woman from the Kālapāda family in the country who was fifteen years old and about to get married when she suddenly died of a headache.

source_sentence: 祇域聞之往至其家，問女父曰：「此女常有何病，乃致夭亡？」
translation: When Jīvaka heard about this, he went to her house and asked her father, "What's always wrong with this girl that she dies young?"

source_sentence: 父曰：「女小有頭痛，日月增甚，今朝發作，尤甚於常，以致絕命。」
translation: Her father said, "My daughter has had headaches since she was a child, and they've gotten worse every month.

source_sentence: 祇域便進，以藥王照視頭中，見有刺蟲，大小相生乃數百枚，鑽食其腦，腦盡故死，便以金刀披破其頭，悉出諸蟲，封著甖中。
translation: He then examined her head with the Yakṣa King and saw that there were hundreds of thorny worms, both large and small, that had been bored into her brain and had died because her brain was exhausted.

source_sentence: 以三種神膏塗瘡：一種者補蟲所食骨間之瘡；一種生腦；一種治外刀瘡。
translation: He applied three kinds of miraculous ointment to his sores: one to repair the sores between his bones that the worms had eaten, one to regenerate his brain, and one to treat external sores.

source_sentence: 告女父曰：「好令安靜，慎莫使驚，十日當愈，平復如故，到其日我當復來。」
translation: He told her father, "Keep her quiet, and don't be alarmed; she'll be healed in ten days and will recover as before; I'll come back on that day."

source_sentence: 祇域適去，女母便更啼哭曰：「我子為再死也，豈有披破頭腦當復活者？
translation: When Gavāṃpati left, her mother wept again, "My son will die again; is there anyone who would come back to life with a broken brain?

source_sentence: 父何忍使人取子那爾。」
translation: Father, how could you bear to allow someone to take your son there?"

source_sentence: 父止之曰：「祇域生而把針藥，棄尊榮位，行作醫師，但為一切命，此乃天之醫王，豈當妄耶！
translation: The father stopped him, saying, "Suppose he were born in Jeta and took medicine and needles, abandoned his venerable position, and became a physician only for the sake of all life; this is the king of doctors in heaven, how could he be false?

source_sentence: 囑語汝言：『慎莫使驚。』
translation: I've told you, 'Be careful not to frighten him.'

source_sentence: 而汝今反啼哭，以驚動之，將令此兒不復得生。」
translation: If you now cry and startle him, this child won't be born again."

source_sentence: 母聞父言，止不復哭，共養護之，寂靜七日。
translation: When her mother heard her father's words, she stopped crying and nursed him back to silence for seven days.

source_sentence: 七日晨明，女便吐氣而寤，如從臥覺曰：「我今者了不復頭痛，身體皆安，誰護我者？
translation: When the morning of the seventh day dawned, she exhaled and woke up as if she'd been lying down, saying, "Now, I don't have any more headaches and my body is all at peace; who's going to protect me?

source_sentence: 使得如是。」
translation: It's possible to do so."

source_sentence: 父曰：「汝前已死，醫王祇域故來護汝，破頭出蟲以得更生。」
translation: Her father said, "You were already dead, so the healing king Jīvaka came to protect you and broke open your head to release the worms so you could be reborn."

source_sentence: 便開甖出蟲示之，女見太便驚怖，深自慶幸：「祇域神乃如是，我促得報其恩。」
translation: He opened his eyebrow and showed it to her. When she saw him, she was terrified and rejoiced, "Thus is the god Jīvaka, and I've been able to repay his kindness."

source_sentence: 父曰：「祇域與我期言：『今日當來。』」
translation: Her father said, "Jīvaka promised me, 'Today he'll come.'"

source_sentence: 於是須臾祇域便來，女歡喜出門迎，頭面作禮，長跪叉手曰：「願為祇域作婢，終身供養，以報更生之恩。」
translation: In a moment, Gṛdhrakūṭa arrived, and the woman rejoiced as she went out to meet him, bowed her head to his face, and knelt down with her palms together, saying, "I wish to be Gṛdhrakūṭa's servant for the rest of my life as a reward for his kindness."

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「我為醫師，周行治病，居無常處，何用婢為？
translation: Jīvaka said, "I'm a doctor who travels around treating illnesses and lives in an impermanent place, so why would I need a servant?

source_sentence: 汝必欲報恩者，與我五百兩金，我亦不用此金，所以求者，凡人學道法當謝師，師雖無以教我，我甞為弟子，今得汝金，當以與之。」
translation: If you must want to repay a kindness, give me five hundred taels of gold. I don't need this gold either, so I'm asking because ordinary people who train in the ways and teachings must thank their teachers.

source_sentence: 女便奉五百兩金，以上祇域。
translation: The woman then presented him with 500 taels of gold and went up to Jīvaka.

source_sentence: 祇域受，以與師，因白王：「暫歸省母，到維耶梨國。」
translation: Guṇavik accepted it and gave it to the teacher. She then said to the king, "Take a moment to return to your mother and go to Vaiśālī."

source_sentence: 爾時，國中復有迦羅越家男兒，好學武事，作一木馬，高七尺餘，日日學習，騙上初學。
translation: It was then that there was another boy from the Kālapatra family in the country who liked to learn martial arts and made a wooden horse more than seven feet tall, and he studied it day by day, deceiving the beginner.

source_sentence: 適得上馬，久久益習，忽過去失據，落地而死。
translation: When he got on the horse, he practiced longer and longer, but suddenly he lost his footing, fell to the ground, and died.

source_sentence: 祇域聞之，便往以藥王照視腹中，見其肝反戾向後，氣結不通故死。
translation: When Jigui heard about it, he went and examined his belly with the Yakṣa King and saw that his liver was turned against him and he was dying because his vital energy was not blocked.

source_sentence: 復以金刀破腹，手探料理，還肝向前畢，以三種神膏塗之，其一種補手所獲持之處；一種通利氣息；一種生合刀瘡。
translation: He then used a gold knife to break open his belly, probed it with his hand, returned his liver to the front, and applied three kinds of miraculous ointment to it, one of which would repair the places where his hand had gotten hold of it, one of which would improve his vitality, and one of which would heal the sores of his sword.

source_sentence: 畢囑語父曰：「慎莫令驚，三日當愈。」
translation: Afterward, he instructed his father, "Don't be alarmed; it will heal in three days."

source_sentence: 父承教勅，寂靜養視。
translation: He was instructed by his father to keep quiet and watch over him.

source_sentence: 至於三日兒便吐氣而寤，狀如臥覺即便起坐，須臾祇域亦來。
translation: In three days, he exhaled and woke up with the appearance of a reclining consciousness and rose to sit up, and in a moment Jīvaka came along.

source_sentence: 兒歡喜出門迎，頭面作禮，長跪白言：「願得為祇域作奴，終身供養，以報再活之恩。」
translation: Rejoicing, the boy went out to meet him, paid homage with his head and face, and knelt down long enough to say, "I wish I could be a slave to Gṛdhrakūṭa and serve him for the rest of my life in return for the gift of being reborn."

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「我為醫師，周行治病，病者之家爭為我使，當用奴為？
translation: Jīvaka said, "I'm a doctor who travels around treating illnesses, and my patients' homes are competing to be my servants.

source_sentence: 我母養我勤苦，我未有供養之恩報母，卿若欲謝我恩者，可與我五百兩金，以報母恩。」
translation: My mother has worked so hard to support me that I haven't had the gift of support to repay her. If you want to thank me for my kindness, you can give me five hundred taels of gold in return for her kindness."

source_sentence: 於是取金以上[木*奈]女，還歸羅閱祇國。
translation: So he took the gold and returned it to Rājagṛha with the [mu*nai] woman as his reward.

source_sentence: 祇域治此四人，馳名天下，莫不聞知。
translation: These four people of Gṛdhrakūṭa became famous throughout the world, and no one was unaware of them.

source_sentence: 又南有大國，去羅閱祇八千里，瓶沙王及諸小國皆臣屬之。
translation: Also to the south was a large country 8,000 miles from Rājagṛha, to which the king of Vibhāṣā and other small states were subordinate.

source_sentence: 其王病疾積年不差，恒苦瞋恚，睚眥殺人，人舉目視之亦殺，低頭不仰亦殺，使人行遲亦殺，疾走亦殺。
translation: When the king's illness lasts for years, he's always bitter and angry, and he kills people with his jaws; he kills people even when they raise their eyes to look at him, kills people even when they bow their heads but don't look up, kills people even when they're slow to move, and kills people even when they run quickly.

source_sentence: 左右侍者，不知當何措手足；醫師合藥，輒疑恐有毒亦殺之。
translation: Those on his right and left don't know what to do with their hands and feet, and when a physician prepares medicine, he often suspects that it's poisonous and also kills them.

source_sentence: 前後所殺，傍臣宮女，及醫師之輩，不可勝數。
translation: The number of ministers, court ladies, and physicians killed before and after was incalculable.

source_sentence: 病日增甚，毒熱攻心，煩懣短氣，如火燒身。
translation: As his illness grew worse, the poisonous fever attacked his heart, and he became so despondent and short of breath that it was like fire burning his body.

source_sentence: 聞有祇域，即為下書，勅瓶沙王徵召祇域。
translation: When he heard about Jīvaka, he sent a message to King Bāṣpa to summon Jīvaka.

source_sentence: 祇域聞此王多殺醫師，大以恐怖，瓶沙又怜其年小恐為所殺，適欲不遣，畏見誅伐，父子相守，晝夜愁憂，不知何計。
translation: When Jīvaka heard that this king often killed physicians, he was terrified, and Bāṣpa pitied him for his youth, fearing that he might be killed, he wished not to send him away, fearing the prospect of retribution.

source_sentence: 爾時，瓶沙王乃將祇域俱往佛所，頭面禮足，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: King Vaiśravaṇa then brought Gṛdhrakūṭa with him to the Buddha, bowed his head and feet, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼王惡性恐殺醫師，為可往不？」
translation: Is that king's evil nature such that he's afraid to kill a physician, or is it acceptable to go there?"

source_sentence: 佛告祇域：「汝宿命時與我約誓，俱當救護天下，我治內病，汝治外病。
translation: The Buddha told Jīvaka, "You promised me during your previous life that you would both help the world, with me treating internal illnesses and you treating external illnesses.

source_sentence: 今我得佛，故如本願會生我前。
translation: Now, since I've attained Buddhahood, I'll be born here before you, as originally vowed.

source_sentence: 此王病篤，遠來迎汝，如何不往？
translation: This king is very ill and has come a long way to greet you, so how could he not go?

source_sentence: 急往救護之，趍作方便，令病必愈，王不殺汝。」
translation: Rushing to his aid, he made himself available to help, so that he would surely be healed and the king wouldn't kill you."

source_sentence: 祇域便承佛威神，往到王所，診省脈理，及以藥王照之，見王五藏及百脈之中血氣擾擾，悉是蛇蟒之毒周匝身體。
translation: Then, in response to the Buddha's authoritative power, Jīvaka went to the king, examined his pulse and looked into it with the king of medicine, and saw that the king's blood and vitality were disturbed in his five stores and one hundred veins, and that the venom of snakes and boa constrictors were all around his body.

source_sentence: 祇域白王：「王病可治，治之保愈，然宜入見太后諮議合藥，若不見太后，藥終不成。」
translation: Jīvaka said to the king, "The king's illness can be treated, and it's guaranteed to heal, but it's better to go in to see the Empress Dowager and consult about combining the medicines; if you don't see her, the medicine will never be effective."

source_sentence: 王聞此語，不解其故，意甚欲怒，然患身病，宿聞祇域之名，故遠迎之，冀必有益，且是小兒，知無他奸，忍而聽之。
translation: When the king heard this, he didn't understand the reason and was very angry, but he was ill and had heard of Jīvaka's name from afar, so he welcomed him, hoping that he would be helped, and since he was a young boy, he knew there was no other kind of fraud, so he tolerated it and listened.

source_sentence: 即遣青衣黃門，將入見太后。
translation: He then sent a man in blue, called Huangmen, who was about to enter to see the Empress Dowager.

source_sentence: 祇域白太后：「王病可治，今當合藥，宜密啟其方，不可宣露，宜屏左右。」
translation: Guṇav told the Empress Dowager, "The king's illness can be cured, and the medicine will now be combined.

source_sentence: 太后即逐青衣黃門去。
translation: The Empress Dowager then expelled the blue-clothed monk from the yellow gate.

source_sentence: 祇域因白太后：「省王病，見身中血氣悉是蛇蟒之毒，似非人類，王為定是誰子？
translation: Guṇḍa then said to the Empress Dowager, "When I examine the king's illness, I see that the blood and vitality in his body are all poison from snakes and boa constrictors, and he doesn't seem to be human.

source_sentence: 太后以實語我，我能治之；若不語我，王病則不可愈。」
translation: If the empress speaks truly to me, I'll be able to treat it; if she doesn't speak to me, the king's illness won't be healed."

source_sentence: 太后曰：「我昔於金柱殿中晝臥，忽有物來厭我上者，我時恍惚，若夢若覺，狀如魘夢，遂與通情。
translation: The Empress said, "Once, when I was lying down in the golden pillar palace, something came along and disgusted me up there.

source_sentence: 忽然而寤，見有大蟒，長三丈餘，從我上去，則覺有軀。
translation: Suddenly, I woke up and saw a large boa, more than three feet long, go up from me, and then I realized there was a body.

source_sentence: 王實是蟒子也，我羞恥此，未曾出口。
translation: The king is really the boa's son; I was ashamed of it and never told him.

source_sentence: 童子今乃覺之，何若神妙！
translation: Now, the boy realizes it. How marvelous!

source_sentence: 若病可治，願以王命委囑童子，今者治之，當用何藥？」
translation: If the disease is treatable, may I entrust the boy with the king's mandate? What medicine should I use to treat it now?"

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「唯有醍醐耳。」
translation: Gavāṃpati said, "There's only ghee."

source_sentence: 太后曰：「咄！
translation: The empress said, "Duh!

source_sentence: 童子慎莫噵醍醐，而王大惡聞醍醐之氣，又惡聞醍醐之名，前後坐口噵醍醐而死者，數千百人。
translation: "The boy carefully refrained from speaking of ghee, but the king greatly disliked hearing the smell of ghee and disliked hearing its name, and thousands of hundreds of people died while sitting in front of or behind him and speaking of ghee.

source_sentence: 汝今噵此，必當殺汝。
translation: Now, if you speak of it, you will surely be killed.

source_sentence: 以此飲王，終不得下，願更用他藥。」
translation: Drinking this to the king will never get you down, so I hope you'll use another medicine."

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「醍醐治毒，毒病惡聞醍醐是也。
translation: Jīvaka said, "Dañjuśrī treats poison, and it's dañjuśrī that's bad for hearing about poisonous illnesses.

source_sentence: 王病若微及是他毒，為有餘藥可以愈之。
translation: If the king's illness were slight and this were another poison, there would be other medicines that could heal it.

source_sentence: 蟒毒既重，又已遍身體，自非醍醐終不能消。
translation: Since the python's poison is so severe and has spread throughout his body, it can't be cured unless it's ghee.

source_sentence: 今當煎煉化令成水，無氣無味，王意不覺，自當飲之。
translation: Now, we'll decoct and refine it so that it becomes water that's breathless and tasteless, and the king will drink it himself if he doesn't feel it.

source_sentence: 藥下必愈，無可憂也。」
translation: The medicine will surely heal him, so there's nothing to worry about."

source_sentence: 便出，見王曰：「向入見太后，已啟藥方，今當合之，十五日當成。
translation: He then went out and met the king, saying, "I went in to see the Empress Dowager and revealed the prescription for this medicine; now I will combine it, and it will be ready in fifteen days.

source_sentence: 今我有五願，王若聽我，病可即愈，若不聽我，病不可愈。」
translation: Now, I have five vows. If the king listens to me, my illness will be healed; if he doesn't, it won't be healed."

source_sentence: 王問：「五願盡何等事？」
translation: The king asked, "What are the five vows?"

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「一者、願得王甲藏中新衣未歷軀者與我；二者、願得令我獨自出入門無呵者；三者、願得日日獨入見太后及王后，莫得禁呵我；四者、願王飲藥當一仰令盡，莫得中息；五者、願得王八千里白象，與我乘之。」
translation: Jīvaka said, "First, may I have the new robes in the king's armor that have yet to reach my body; second, may I be allowed to enter and leave the gate alone without being heckled; third, may I enter alone every day to see the queen and the king's mistress and not be forbidden from heckling me; fourth, may the king drink the medicine once and make it last, so that I don't have to take a midday rest; and fifth, may I have the king's 8,000-league white elephant to ride with me."

source_sentence: 王聞大怒曰：「兒子何敢求是五願？
translation: The king was furious when he heard that, "How dare your son ask for these five vows?

source_sentence: 促具解之，若不能解，今棒殺汝。
translation: "Urge them to understand it, or if they can't, I'll club you to death.

source_sentence: 汝何敢求我新衣？
translation: How dare you ask me for new clothes?

source_sentence: 為欲殺我，便著我衣，詐作我身耶？」
translation: Is it because you want to kill me that you put on my clothes and pretend to be me?"

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「合藥宜當精潔齋戒，而我來日久，衣被皆塵垢故，欲得王衣以之合藥。」
translation: Gavāṃpati said, "It's appropriate to combine medicine with cleanliness and discipline, but since I've been here for a long time, my robes are covered in dirt, so I'd like to obtain the king's robes to combine with medicine."

source_sentence: 王意解曰：「如此，大佳！
translation: The king understood, "That would be very nice!

source_sentence: 汝何故欲得自出入宮門令無禁呵？
translation: Why do you want to be able to enter and leave the palace on your own, so that there's no prohibition against heckling?

source_sentence: 欲因此將兵來攻殺我耶？」
translation: Do you want to bring your troops here to attack and kill me for this reason?"

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「王前後使諸師醫，皆嫌疑之，無所委信，又誅殺之，不服其藥，群臣皆言王當復殺我。
translation: Gavāṃpati said, "The king has sent various physicians before and after him, but they all suspect him and don't trust him; they also kill him and don't accept his medicine, and the ministers all say the king will kill me again.

source_sentence: 而王病已甚，恐外人生心作亂。
translation: The king has become very ill, and I'm afraid that outsiders will become disruptive.

source_sentence: 若令我自出入不見禁呵，外人大小皆知王信我，必服我藥病必當愈，則不敢生逆亂之心。」
translation: If I were allowed to go in and out on my own without being told, outsiders of all sizes would know that the king trusts me and will take my medicine to heal his illness, so they wouldn't dare to become disruptive."

source_sentence: 王曰：「大佳！
translation: The king said, "Excellent!

source_sentence: 汝何故日日獨入，見我母及我婦？
translation: Why do you enter alone every day and see my mother and my wife?

source_sentence: 欲作婬亂耶？」
translation: Do you want to commit sexual misconduct?"

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「王前後殺人甚多，臣下大小各懷恐怖，皆不願王之安隱，無可信者今共合藥，因我顧睨之間，便投毒藥，我所不覺，則非小事。
translation: Gavāṃpati said, "The king has killed many people before and after him, and his ministers, both large and small, are terrified that they don't want the king's peace and quiet.

source_sentence: 故思惟可信者，恩情無二，唯有母與婦，故敢入見太后王后，與共合藥，當煎十五日乃成故，欲日日入伺候火齊耳。」
translation: Therefore, I thought, "Trustworthy people have no two kinds of kindnesses but a mother and a wife, so I dared to go in to see the Queen Mother and the King's Queen to share the medicine with them.

source_sentence: 王曰：「大佳！
translation: The king said, "Excellent!

source_sentence: 汝何故使我飲藥，一仰令盡，不得中息？
translation: Why did you make me drink this medicine, making it last after one gulp, so that I wouldn't be able to take a midday rest?

source_sentence: 為欲內毒恐我覺耶？」
translation: Is it because you want to prevent internal poison from making you aware of me?"

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「藥有劑數，氣味宜當相及，若其中息，則氣不相繼。」
translation: Jīvaka said, "There are doses of medicine, and it's appropriate for the taste to be mutual; if it's calming, then the energy won't continue."

source_sentence: 王曰：「大佳！
translation: The king said, "Excellent!

source_sentence: 汝何故欲得我象乘之？
translation: Why do you want to get a ride on my elephant?

source_sentence: 此象是我國寶，一日行八千里，我所以威伏諸國，正怙此象。
translation: This elephant is my country's treasure, which travels 8,000 miles in a day, and it's the reason I'm so powerful over other countries.

source_sentence: 汝欲乘之，為欲盜以歸家，與汝父攻我國耶？」
translation: Do you want to ride it because you want to steal it so you can return home and attack my country with your father?"

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「乃南界山中有神妙藥草，去此四千里，王飲藥宜當即得此草，重復服之，故欲乘此象詣往採之，朝去暮還，令藥味相及。」
translation: Jīvaka said, "It's because there's a wonderful medicinal herb in the southern sector of the mountains that's 4,000 miles away from here, and it would be a good idea for the king to drink the medicine and get the herb to take again.

source_sentence: 王意大解，皆悉聽之。
translation: The king's thoughts were greatly persuaded, and he listened to them all.

source_sentence: 於是祇域煎煉醍醐，十五日成，化如清水，凡得五升，便與太后王后俱捧藥出，白王：「可服，願被白象預置殿前。」
translation: It was then decocted by Jīvaka into ghee, which was ready in fifteen days and turned into clear water, amounting to five liters. He then took the medicine out with the Queen and the Queen Mother and said to the king, "It's ready to be taken.

source_sentence: 王即聽之。
translation: The king then complied.

source_sentence: 王見藥但如清水，初無氣味，不知是醍醐，又太后、王后身自臨合信其非毒，便如本要一飲而盡。
translation: Seeing that the medicine was just like clear water and had no taste at first, the king didn't know it was ghee, and the Empress and the Queen were convinced by their own union that it wasn't poisonous, so he drank it all at once as before.

source_sentence: 祇域便乘象，徑去還羅閱祇國。
translation: Jīvaka then rode off on an elephant and headed back to Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 爾時，祇域適行三千里。
translation: At the time, Jīvaka had traveled 3,000 miles.

source_sentence: 祇域年小力膂尚微，不堪疾迅，頭眩疲極，便止息臥。
translation: Being too young and weak to travel quickly, Jijivi became dizzy and exhausted, so he stopped to lie down.

source_sentence: 到日過中，王噫氣出聞醍醐臭，便更大怒曰：「小兒敢以醍醐中我，怪兒所以求我白象，正欲叛去？」
translation: When the sun had passed, the king yawned and smelled the stench of ghee, so he became even more furious and said, "How dare you hit me with ghee, little boy? Is that why you're asking for my white elephant, because you want to rebel?"

source_sentence: 王有勇士之臣名曰烏，神足步行能及此象，即呼烏曰：「汝急往逐取兒來，生將以還，我欲目前捶殺之。
translation: The king had a brave servant named Crow, whose spiritual legs could reach this elephant on foot, and he summoned Crow, saying, "Hurry and fetch the boy, for he will be born again, and I want to kill him now.

source_sentence: 汝性常不廉，貪於食，故名為烏，此醫師輩多喜行毒，若兒為汝設食，慎莫食也！」
translation: You're always unscrupulous and crave food, so you're called a crow. This group of doctors often likes to practice poison; if a son sets food for you, be careful not to eat it!"

source_sentence: 烏受勅便行，及之於山中，曰：「汝何故以醍醐中王，而云是藥？
translation: U received the command and went on his way. When he arrived in the mountains, he said, "Why did you tell the king of ghee that it was medicine?

source_sentence: 王故令我追呼汝還，汝急隨我還，陳謝自首庶可望活，若故欲走，今必殺汝終不得脫。」
translation: The king therefore told me to summon you back, so hurry and follow me back, saying thank you and surrendering yourself so that you might hope to live; if you had wanted to leave, I would have killed you and never gotten away."

source_sentence: 祇域自念：「我雖作方便求此白象，復不得脫，今當復作方便，何可隨去？」
translation: Jīvaka thought to himself, "Even though I did something skillful to get this white elephant, I couldn't get rid of it again; now I'll do it again, so why should I go along with it?"

source_sentence: 乃謂烏言：「我朝來未食，還必當死，寧可假我須臾，得於山間啖果飲水，飽而就死乎！」
translation: He then said to the crow, "I haven't eaten since morning, and I'm sure to die again; perhaps I could go to the mountains for a moment, eat fruit and drink water, get fed, and then die!"

source_sentence: 烏見祇域小兒，畏死懼怖言辭辛苦，怜而聽之曰：「促食當去，不得久留。」
translation: Seeing Jeta's little boy, he was afraid of death and spoke harshly, but he took pity on him and listened, saying, "You must hurry to eat; you mustn't stay long."

source_sentence: 祇域乃取一梨，喫食其半，以毒藥著爪甲中，以分餘半，便置於地；又取一杯水，先飲其半，又行爪下毒於餘水中，復置於地。
translation: Gṛdhrakūṭa then took a pear, ate half of it, put poison in his fingernails, divided the other half, and put it on the ground; he also took a cup of water, drank half of it, put the poison under his fingernails in the rest of the water, and put it on the ground again.

source_sentence: 乃歎曰：「水及梨皆是天藥，既清香且美，其飲食此者，令人身安，百病皆愈，氣力兼倍，恨其不在國都之下，百姓當共得之，而在深山之中，人不知也，便進入山索求他果。」
translation: He then praised them, saying, "The water and the pear are both heavenly medicines that are fragrant and beautiful.

source_sentence: 烏性既貪，不能忍於飲食，又聞祇域歎為神藥，亦見祇域已飲食之，謂必無毒，便取餘梨食之，盡飲餘水，便下痢，痢如注水，躃地而臥，起輒眩倒，不能復動。
translation: Being greedy, Uṣa could not tolerate food and drink, and hearing that Jīvaka praised it as a miracle medicine, he also saw that Jīvaka had eaten it and assumed it must not be poisonous, so he took the remaining pears and ate them, drank all the remaining water, and then had dysentery, which was like pouring water.

source_sentence: 祇域曰：「王服我藥，病必當愈，然今藥力未行，餘毒未盡，我今往者，必當殺我。
translation: Jīvaka said, "The king will surely be cured if he takes my medicine, but now the medicine hasn't worked and the remaining poison hasn't ended, so someone who goes to me now will surely kill me.

source_sentence: 汝無所知，起欲得我以解身負，故使汝病，病自無苦，慎莫動搖，三日當差；若起逐我，必死不疑。」
translation: You don't know anything about it, but you want to get me to relieve you of your burden, so I made you sick. Your illness will be painless; don't be disturbed, and you'll be fine for three days; if you get up and chase me away, you'll surely die without question."

source_sentence: 便上象而去。
translation: He then mounted the elephant and departed.

source_sentence: 祇域則過墟聚，語長伍曰：「此是國王使，今忽得病，汝等急往，舁取歸家，好養護之，厚其床席，給與糜粥，慎莫令死，死者王滅汝國。」
translation: Gavāṃpati then passed through the marketplace and told the officers, "This is the king's envoy. Now that he's suddenly taken ill, you must hurry to take him home, nurture him well, give him a thick bed and mat, and give him rice and gruel; be careful not to let him die, or the king will annihilate your country."

source_sentence: 語畢便去，遂歸本國。
translation: After speaking these words, they departed and returned to their own country.

source_sentence: 長伍承勅，迎取養護，三日毒歇下絕，烏便歸見王，叩頭自陳曰：「我實愚癡，違負王教，信祇域言，飲食其餘水果，為其所中，下痢三日，始今旦差，自知當死。」
translation: When he had received the order from the commander, he took him home and nurtured him for three days, then he returned to the king, bowed his head, and told him, "I was really foolish. I disobeyed the king's teaching, believed his words, ate and drank the other fruits, and was struck by them.

source_sentence: 比烏還三日之中，王病已差，王自追念：「悔遣烏往行。」
translation: When he had been sick for three days, the king reflected on himself, "I regret sending that crow on a journey."

source_sentence: 見烏來還，且悲且喜曰：「賴汝不即將兒來，當我恚時必當捶殺，我得其恩，命得生活，而反殺之，逆戾不細。」
translation: When he saw Crow coming back, he was both sad and happy, saying, "If you hadn't brought him back right away, you would have killed him when I was angry.

source_sentence: 即悔前後所抂殺者，悉更厚葬，復其家門賜與錢財。
